intro: Guarea leptotricha, commonly known as the blackwood tree, is a tropical evergreen species native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable hardwoods. The tree is characterized by its dark, heavy wood and compound leaves with long, slender leaflets. It typically grows in lowland tropical forests and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. The plant is also noted for its fragrant flowers and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
